articles.author: Anna Mehler Paperny
articles.description: Four Canadian ministers publicly unveiled on Tuesday a border security plan they had privately presented to U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's incoming administration, with an emphasis on surveillance, intelligence and technology.
articles.title: Canada pledges beefed-up border, immigration restrictions to appease Trump

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Argentine President Javier Milei on Tuesday demanded that Venezuelan authorities immediately free an Argentine soldier arrested earlier this month who Milei said entered Venezuela to visit family, in the latest flare-up between the two South American nations.
articles.title: Argentine president demands release of soldier arrested in Venezuela

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mary Jane Veloso, who received a last-minute reprieve from execution by firing squad for drug trafficking in Indonesia in 2015, arrived in Manila in the early hours of Wednesday after years of negotiations between the two Southeast Asian countries.
articles.title: Mary Jane Veloso, Filipina death-row prisoner in Indonesia, arrives home

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un on Tuesday visited a mausoleum for his late father and grandfather Kim Jong Il and Kim Il Sung to pay tribute to his father, state media reported on Wednesday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim visits family tomb to pay tribute to his father

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: Mangione was indicted on 11 counts, including first-degree murder and murder as a crime of terrorism. The indictment accused Mangione of murdering Thompson with the intent to "influence the policy of a unit of government by intimidation or coercion."
articles.title: Luigi Mangione sought to 'sow terror' in UnitedHealth executive killing, prosecutor says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australia's government on Wednesday trimmed its likely budget deficit for the current fiscal year, but flagged bigger shortfalls ahead due to "unavoidable spending" on health, cost-of-living relief and veterans care.
articles.title: Australia's government spends its way to bigger budget deficits

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's President Xi Jinping arrives in Macau on Wednesday to mark a quarter century of Beijing's rule over the former Portuguese enclave, and is likely during his three-day visit to urge further diversification from its casino industry.
articles.title: Xi Jinping visits Macau to mark 25 years of Chinese rule

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lawmakers in Brazil's lower house of Congress approved on Tuesday a bill that includes regulations needed to implement a constitutional tax reform, following a Senate vote to approve the bill.
articles.title: Brazil lawmakers pass key regulations to enact tax reform

articles.author: Francesco Guarascio, Khanh Vu
articles.description: Vietnam will showcase locally made weapons at an international arms fair in Hanoi on Thursday, as it seeks to boost its domestic industry and possibly export military equipment.
articles.title: Vietnam seeks to boost domestic defence industry as it hosts arms fair

articles.author: Lucy Craymer
articles.description: New Zealand will provide financial compensation to children and teens who were abused at a state psychiatric hospital in the 1970s and issue a written letter of apology that explicitly acknowledges torture, the government said on Wednesday.
articles.title: New Zealand announces payouts for children and teens abused in care
